paragraph_US: Used as an aid in the diagnosis of thyroid autoimmune disorders including    Hashimoto disease, postpartum thyroiditis, neonatal hypothyroidism,    and Graves disease.   Differentiating thyroid autoimmune disorders from non-autoimmune   goiter or hypothyroidism
paragraph_SI: Used as an aid in the diagnosis of thyroid autoimmune disorders including    Hashimoto disease, postpartum thyroiditis, neonatal hypothyroidism,    and Graves disease.   Differentiating thyroid autoimmune disorders from non-autoimmune   goiter or hypothyroidism

paragraph_US: Disorders of the thyroid gland are frequently caused by autoimmune    mechanisms that generate the production of autoantibodies. Two    antibodies of diagnostic use are thyroperoxidase antibodies    (TPO-Ab) and thyroglobulin antibodies (Tg-Ab), which bind   thyroperoxidase (TPO) and thyroglobulin (Tg), respectively.       TPO and Tg are thyroid-specific proteins that play a crucial role    in thyroid hormone synthesis and storage. Noniodinated Tg is    actively transported from thyrocyte cytosol to the thyroid follicular  lumen. At the extracellular apical villae:follicular luminal inter
